Module miranda.c482retry
Package miranda.c482retry

Class ModifyPartController

java.lang.Object
miranda.c482retry.ModifyPartController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyPartController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for modifying a part in the inventory management system. Allows the user to edit and save details of a part.

  • Method Details

    • onActionInHouseRadio

      public void onActionInHouseRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event when the In-House radio button is selected. Changes the label to "Machine ID."
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by selecting the In-House radio button.

    • onActionOutHouseRadio

      public void onActionOutHouseRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event when the Outsourced radio button is selected. Changes the label to "Company Name."
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by selecting the Outsourced radio button.

    • partData

      public void partData(Part part)
      Sets the data of the selected part to the form fields for editing.
      Parameters:
      part - The part object to be edited.

    • onActionSavePart

      public void onActionSavePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event for saving the modified part. Validates input fields, updates the part, and returns to the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Save" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while loading the main form.

    • onActionDisplayMainForm

      public void onActionDisplayMainForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event for displaying the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Back" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while loading the main form.

      Initializes the controller.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
